Name: Stela of Seneb-em-yu
Description: In the lunette of this stela, two udjat-eyes flank a shen-ring. In the first register a man is seated on the left in front of an offering table. There is a vertical line of text between him and the seated woman facing him. In front of her is also a low offering table. The second register depicts three standing men, each separated from the next by two columns of text containing the offering formula. Underneath, the "appeal to the living" in eleven columns of text fills the remaining space. The stela is framed by a single carved line. The texts are incised, the scenes have been executed is raised relief. The upper left edge of the stela is broken off.
